bio:treatment.description: Panicles nodding distally; branches flexible; pulvini inconspicuously or conspicuously hairy, hairs confined to the adaxial side of the branches.
bio:treatment.discussion: Tridens flavus var. flavus grows in old fields and open woods. Its range extends to Nuevo LÃ©on, Mexico. It was discovered for the first time in Canada in 1976, growing along a railway track in southern Ontario.
